intro: Ononis grandiflora, commonly known as largeflowered sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and succulent, adapted to thrive in dry, sandy or rocky soils. Ononis grandiflora is often found in disturbed areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
